article.headline: Temple 69, Richmond 30
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Mardy Collins scored 22 points and Temple held Richmond to its lowest point total in more than 60 years in a 69-30 victory on Wednesday night. Temple (15-10, 8-6 Atlantic 10) scored the first 15 points of the game and the first 17 of the second half. The Owls allowed their fewest points in a game since beating West Chester 39-27 on Dec. 3, 1974. Kevin Steenberge scored 15 points for Richmond (11-15, 4-9), which lost its seventh straight game. It was the fewest points scored by the Spiders since a 31-25 loss to Virginia Tech on Feb. 1, 1946. Richmond was scoreless for the first 6:48 of the game and the first 12:09 of the second half. The Spiders didn't reach 30 points until Monty Sanders converted a pair of free throws with 2.6 seconds left. Temple outrebounded Richmond 38-20, and the Spiders shot 12-for-45 (26.7 percent), including 4-for-29 from 3-point range. Mark Tyndale finished with 17 for Temple, which improved to 11-1 at the Liacouras Center this season. The Owls face top-ranked Duke on Saturday.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
